instruction: In a large bowl, combine yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, salt, cardamom powder, and nutmeg-mace powder.
title: Marinate the Mutton - Step 1

transcript_segments.text: Today we’re making Lucknowi Chicken Biryani, also known as Awadhi Chicken Biryani. It’s a lightly spiced biryani with a very rich flavor. First, we’ll take half a cup of oil.

instruction: Add half of the fried onions (birista) to the yogurt mixture and mix well.
title: Marinate the Mutton - Step 2

transcript_segments.text: We’ll lightly fry the onions to golden. Once they are fried, add 1 kg chicken. As soon as we add it, increase the flame to high and mix the chicken well with the oil. Fry it nicely on high flame.

Add 5 cloves. With just these whole spices, we'll roast the chicken until the raw smell of ginger-garlic goes away. Continue mixing on high flame. This biryani uses yellow chili powder which adds excellent flavor.

Add 2 tbsp of yellow chili powder and 1 tbsp of red chili powder. Mix the chicken well with these spices for 1 to 1.5 minutes. Now reduce the flame to low and add 3/4 cup of whisked curd — about 150 grams.
To make biryani masala, take 10g green cardamom, 10g mace (javitri), and half a nutmeg. Grind them into a fine aromatic powder. Add ½ tsp of this biryani masala into the pan.
Now mix the curd thoroughly with the chicken. Once it is well mixed, increase the flame again. Once the chicken boils nicely, add about half a cup of water. Let it cook well.
Add 3–4 drops of sweet ittar (aromatic essence). Cover and cook the chicken for at least 15 minutes on medium to low flame. Cook it 80–90% through. The rest will cook with the rice later.
Now strain the broth (yakhni) properly. Squeeze out all the flavor from the spices while straining.

instruction: Add the mutton pieces and coat them thoroughly with the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight.
title: Marinate the Mutton - Step 3

transcript_segments.text: Now strain the broth (yakhni) properly. Squeeze out all the flavor from the spices while straining.

instruction: Soak saffron strands in warm milk for 10–15 minutes to release color and aroma.
title: Prepare Saffron Milk - Step 1

transcript_segments.text: Now strain the broth (yakhni) properly. Squeeze out all the flavor from the spices while straining.

instruction: Add rose water and kewra water to the saffron milk. Mix gently and set aside.
title: Prepare Saffron Milk - Step 2

transcript_segments.text: Now add all the fragrance: 1 tbsp kewra water, 1 tbsp rose water, 3–4 drops of sweet ittar, and 1 cup of milk to make the biryani even richer.
Mix everything well. This fragrant yakhni is now ready. Now scoop out 2–3 tablespoons of the oil or gravy (rogan) from the top. Save about 1 tbsp more for layering later.

instruction: Rinse basmati rice thoroughly until the water runs clear. Soak in water for 30 minutes, then drain.
title: Boil the Rice - Step 1

transcript_segments.text: Add green cardamom and a bay leaf. Add 2 tbsp of salt. Also, add 2 tbsp of ghee — this makes the rice soft and rich. Squeeze in half a lemon.

instruction: In a large vessel, bring ample water to a boil. Add bay leaves, cinnamon stick, green cardamoms, cloves, star anise, black cumin seeds, and salt.
title: Boil the Rice - Step 2

transcript_segments.text: Add green cardamom and a bay leaf. Add 2 tbsp of salt. Also, add 2 tbsp of ghee — this makes the rice soft and rich. Squeeze in half a lemon.

instruction: Add the soaked rice to the boiling water and cook until the grains are about 70% done—firm with a slight bite.
title: Boil the Rice - Step 3

transcript_segments.text: Cook the rice until it is about 75% done. Use the same pot in which we prepared the chicken for layering the biryani.
Drizzle a little ghee in the base. Spread a layer of 75% cooked rice evenly. Now add the chicken. After that, pour the aromatic yakhni over it.

instruction: Drain the rice immediately to prevent overcooking and spread it out to cool slightly.
title: Boil the Rice - Step 4

transcript_segments.text: Drizzle a little ghee in the base. Spread a layer of 75% cooked rice evenly. Now add the chicken. After that, pour the aromatic yakhni over it.

instruction: In a heavy-bottomed pot or handi, grease the base with ghee.
title: Layering the Biryani - Step 1

transcript_segments.text: Drizzle a little ghee in the base. Spread a layer of 75% cooked rice evenly. Now add the chicken. After that, pour the aromatic yakhni over it.

instruction: Spread the marinated mutton evenly on the bottom as the first layer.
title: Layering the Biryani - Step 2

transcript_segments.text: Drizzle a little ghee in the base. Spread a layer of 75% cooked rice evenly. Now add the chicken. After that, pour the aromatic yakhni over it.

instruction: Add a layer of the partially cooked rice over the mutton.
title: Layering the Biryani - Step 3

transcript_segments.text: Drizzle a little ghee in the base. Spread a layer of 75% cooked rice evenly. Now add the chicken. After that, pour the aromatic yakhni over it.

instruction: Sprinkle the remaining fried onions, chopped mint, and coriander leaves on top.
title: Layering the Biryani - Step 4

transcript_segments.text: Drizzle a little ghee in the base. Spread a layer of 75% cooked rice evenly. Now add the chicken. After that, pour the aromatic yakhni over it.

instruction: Drizzle the prepared saffron milk evenly over the top rice layer.
title: Layering the Biryani - Step 5

transcript_segments.text: Drain the remaining water from the rice and layer it on top. After layering all the rice, pour the saved rogan mixture over it. Add a bit of orange food color. You can also soak saffron in milk and add that.

instruction: Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid or aluminum foil to trap steam.
title: Seal and Cook on Dum - Step 1

transcript_segments.text: Drain the remaining water from the rice and layer it on top. After layering all the rice, pour the saved rogan mixture over it. Add a bit of orange food color. You can also soak saffron in milk and add that.

instruction: Seal the edges with kneaded dough if using a traditional lid, to ensure no steam escapes.
title: Seal and Cook on Dum - Step 2

transcript_segments.text: Drain the remaining water from the rice and layer it on top. After layering all the rice, pour the saved rogan mixture over it. Add a bit of orange food color. You can also soak saffron in milk and add that.

instruction: Place the sealed pot on a low flame or a griddle (tava) to prevent direct heat and cook for 45–60 minutes.
title: Seal and Cook on Dum - Step 3

transcript_segments.text: Cover and cook the biryani on low flame for 20–25 minutes. After 20 minutes, remove the lid. This biryani doesn’t use coriander, mint leaves, or fried onions — just enjoy it as is.

instruction: Turn off the heat and let the biryani rest undisturbed for 10–15 minutes to allow the flavors to settle.
title: Rest and Serve - Step 1

instruction: Carefully open the seal, gently fluff the rice using a flat spoon, and serve hot with raita or salan.
